fields.description:
This page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Estimating+an+Issue

Step 3 of estimating an issue: "Enter an Estimate for each issue by clicking the Estimate field on the right-hand side of the row. "

This seems to indicate you can estimate issues in-line on the same row while trimming the Backlog or estimating scheduled Sprints. This is currently not possible. You have to estimate the issue in detail view pane.

Our documentation should be updated to reflect this.
fields.summary: Estimate issues in Plan Mode referring to feature not available

fields.description: It would be great to have the ability to estimate issues in-line on scheduled Sprints or Backlog list of issue. See screenshot for clarification.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to estimate issues in-line on scheduled Sprint or the Backlog without using detail view

fields.description:
As of now, the documentation states that " (Simplified Workflow) Has three default steps for Scrum boards: To Do, In Progress, Done". That won't be the case if the original workflow has more Statuses. Quoting the pop-up in GreenHopper after actually clicking *Simplify*: 
{panel}The simplified workflow will:
- allow free movement of issues between any column
- remove all transition conditions, validators, post functions and screens{panel}
There's no mention of Statuses there, and indeed that's the GreenHopper behaviour - simplifying a Workflow doesn't involve removing Statuses.
fields.summary: Update Using GreenHopper Simplified Workflow - statuses

fields.description:
I want to be able to show a visual of all sprints related to a version using the sprint gadget.  However, the sprint gadget allows me to only select incomplete sprints. 

Please provide an option to allow a user to show a complete sprint vs only open sprints so that we can provide a complete picture for a version.
fields.summary: Allow sprint gadget to show any sprint
Double-encoding of sprint names on Velocity Report

fields.description:
When viewing an epic, we want to see the total story points and hours estimated for all issues related to the epic (those is the Issues in Epic section).  

For example:

Story issue screen has shows the desired estimate time:

!story-estimate.png|thumbnail!

But, not in Epic issue screen:
!epic-estimate.png|thumbnail!

We want these fields to be available when viewing a list of issues in a filter and be included in any associated export and columns available when viewing in any of the related JIRA gadgets. 

These fields are necessary to get a quick view of the total scope when viewing in JIRA as well as creating reports for additional reporting and analysis; it needs to be in the gadgets to support executive/management level reports/summaries.
fields.summary: Sum story points or hour estimates for any epic links

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Removing+an+Issue+from+a+Sprint
fields.summary: document the context menu in Work mode

fields.description:
In kanban, you still story point and target versions. 
Provide reports similar to what is provided for a sprint.  You should still be able to show a version report that shows story points burned and targeted for the version; unestimated stories, etc. 

You can also create a similar report for kanban if you allow the user to input from/thru dates. 

Provide the associated gadgets to display the same thing on jira dashboards and confluence pages for reporting.
fields.summary: Provide a kanban chart report and gadget that shows story points

fields.description:
Provide the same version management in KanBan plan mode as you do with sprints. 

Even with KanBan, as a product owner, you still define themes and minimum viable necessary for a release. I still assign them to a version and once we have something ready for release, we do. 

Having the same version support allows us to have the same processes for either board vs having to go into JIRA to do version management and reporting or create an artificial sprint board to do this - both are disruptive to processes when it is inconsistent with scrum boards.
fields.summary: Provide Version management in KanBan plan mode
As a Scrum Master or Project Manager, I would like Statistics on Sub-Tasks to be calculated when reporting Epics

fields.description:
When creating a workflow scheme, if you select the workflows to each issue type one by one, even if you choose the same workflow for all issue types, Greenhopper doesn't allow you to Simplify the Workflow, even if all the other restrictions on [Using GreenHopper Simplified Workflow - why Not|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+GreenHopper+Simplified+Workflow#UsingGreenHopperSimplifiedWorkflow-whyNot] are true.

I've attached two screenshots as an example.

!OnDemand.png!

!Standalone.png!

h4. Workaround 

Only map the "All Unassigned issue types" in the workflow scheme.
fields.summary: Cannot simplify workflow when all issue types are mapped to the same workflow but individually

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Story has no change history for Story Points, even though it has a Story Point value it will not appear in the Burndown Chart.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Get a Story into a state where it does not have a change history for Story Points, but *has* Story Points.
(!) We're unsure about how to make this happen, but it has happened.
# Add that Story to a new Sprint.
# Generate a burndown chart.

h3. Expected Results

The Story Points are displayed for the Story.

h3. Actual Results

The Story Points are displayed as "-".

h3. Notes

This can be worked around by adding and removing the story points to the issue, which will update the change history.

Another bug is that when removing the story points the error is reported as "Estimate of undefined has been added".
fields.summary: Stories in Sprint Burndown Chart do not display Story Points

fields.description: ...unlike the Control Chart.

* Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8671].
  {panel}

When upgrading GreenHopper, can you please verify if they are using the correct Issue Types? We do a lot of verification on the Custom Fields now and lock them down if they're the defaults, however there's no verification of Issue Types.

GreenHopper can somehow get into a state where the Issue Types are not correct in the database and this will cause all sorts of problems, such as the linked issue.

Thanks!

h3. Workaround

This can be fixed using [How to Fix the Duplicate GreenHopper Custom Fields After Upgrading|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+to+Fix+the+Duplicate+GreenHopper+Custom+Fields+After+Upgrading], specifically steps 4 - 9.
fields.summary: When upgrading, please verify the Issue Types are correct

fields.description:
At the moment, a GreenHopper board can only use one project, or can be shared with multiple projects. However, the limitation is that all projects must be from the same JIRA instance. 

It would be useful if user can manage one board, across multiple JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Allow integration of multiple JIRA instance into a single GreenHopper board

If possible, the report shall be visible in Confluence as well.

fields.description:
The idea of creating a statistical report of *GreenHopper* usage per user basis came from the idea of a one of the *GreenHopper* users. He attached the snippet of the access log, pretty much a manual way of calculating how many times the user is using *GreenHopper*. On the other hand, it would be handy if we can have some sort of reporting for this. The statistic table / report would be something like the following:
|*USER*|*COUNT*|
|user1|xx|
|user2|zz|

As of now, the user is suggesting the usage of the *access logs* by having the following fields:
{code}
IP Request_Id User Timestamp  "HTTP_Method URL Protocol_Version" HTTP_Status_Code ResponseSize_in_Bytes RequestTime_In_Millis Referer User_Agent SESSIONID
{code}

Which outputs the following:
{code}
xx.yy.zzz.ww 913x1713544x1 user1 [22/Apr/2013:15:13:33 -0700] "GET /rest/api/1.0/menus/greenhopper_menu?_=1366668812984 HTTP/1.1" 200 316 14 "http://jira.intuit.com/secure/ConfigurePortalPages!default.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_3) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31" "mfwyr9"
xx.yy.zzz.ww 913x1713583x4 user1 [22/Apr/2013:15:13:35 -0700] "GET /rest/api/1.0/shortcuts/813/5ad1321139e324fd7a9ad2aeee09dae3/shortcuts.js?context=greenhopper HTTP/1.1" 200 563 15 "http://jira.intuit.com/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_3) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31" "mfwyr9"
xx.yy.zzz.ww 913x1713605x1 user1 [22/Apr/2013:15:13:37 -0700] "GET /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/list.json?_=1366668816279 HTTP/1.1" 200 7159 867 "http://jira.intuit.com/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_3) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31" "mfwyr9"
xx.yy.zzz.ww 929x1719606x3 user1 [22/Apr/2013:15:29:41 -0700] "PUT /rest/greenhopper/1.0/userData/quickEditDefaults HTTP/1.1" 200 91 13 "http://jira.intuit.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1025&view=planning" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_3) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31" "mfwyr9"
xx.yy.zzz.ww 929x1719611x2 user1 [22/Apr/2013:15:29:42 -0700] "GET /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/epics.json?rapidViewId=1025&_=1366669782310 HTTP/1.1" 200 631 253 "http://jira.intuit.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1025&view=planning" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_3) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31" "mfwyr9"
{code}

Any possibilities of this being implemented in the future release of *GreenHopper*?
fields.summary: GreenHopper Usage Report per User Basis

fields.description:
As Patrick, I want to be able to specify which statuses transitions to which trigger the resolution field to be set to done so that my issues have any resolution at all.

Solution

1. Allow for a tickbox per status, which makes the global transition to that status set the resolution to "Done".
2. Unmapped statuses will also display this information (not necessarily the option to change it)
3. During the conversion to simplified workflow, the user will be presented with the default choice of statuses from the "Done" column selected for the resolution but should be able to override it before finishing the conversion.

Note that this will help people who are migrating as well as ones who have already migrated to simplified workflow.

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: Is this changed in GreenHopper Configuration?
A: (/) Its board specific so its in board configuration.

Q: How do we display the valid options as a part of the simplify dialog?
A: (/) With a multi select combo box

Q: How many statuses can you tick?
A: (/) No Limit

Q: What happens if the user moves a status to another column?
A: (/) The column is moved, the tick is not changed

Q: What if the user deletes a column that has a ticked box?
A: (/) Just move all statuses to unmapped column

Q: What if a status is dragged to unmapped?
A: (/) Should be disabled but visible
fields.summary: Allow to set resolution in Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
As Patrick, I want to be able to add an issue to an empty epic when in JIRA so that I can fill it in easily.

Notes:

This can be achieved either via issue operation or always showing the existing "issues in epic" panel
fields.summary: Add an issue to an Epic from JIRA when no other issues have been added to it yet

fields.description: As Patrick, I want to be able to see autocomplete when querying Epic Link in JQL so that it's easy to write queries without making spelling mistakes.
fields.summary: Autocomplete for Epic Link in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8662].
  {panel}

As Patrick I want to be able to assign a story to a future sprint so that it's query-able (via sprint id).

A/C:

1. I am able to create future sprints which I can assign issues to
2. I'm able to remove future sprints and the issues are removed from them
3. I'm able to move issues between future sprints and out of future sprints and the db is updated accordingly
4. The backlog shows all future sprints, regardless of whether they are empty or not

Notes:

- as part of this, the necessary DB work to enable future sprints needs to happen

(!) Dev Notes (!)

h4. Functionality that changes:
- Send to Top (from JIRA)
- Sprint dragging will not include filtered issues

Q: What happens if a sprint becomes orphaned aka all assigned boards are deleted?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if the sprint's owning board was deleted but it was visible on a second board?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if a non-visible orphaned sprint was included in the filter of a new board? Is it reassigned?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if there are multiple rank fields?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Do sprints need their own rank field? If so, is it locked? What if it is deleted/modified in JIRA 5.1?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What are the conditions for the migration task?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens to sprints for which all issues have been deleted?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if an issue is assigned to more than 1 future sprint via different boards?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Assign a story to future sprint

fields.description: It probably should be the other way around - version name stays at the same line and project name goes to the next line. In the screenshots - 302... on the same line.

fields.description:
Currently when planning a sprint, dragging the sprint bar adds issues to the new sprint according to the order the issues are shown. If I have 40 issues and drag the bar down by 10, I get 10 issues in the new sprint and 30 outside. Dragging individual issues around lets me change this.
However, when using filters, the plan mode does exactly the same - namely _showing_ 15 total filtered issues while there are _actually_ 40 issues. Dragging the bar down by 10 adds _at least_ 10 issues, and depending on the filter it may add up to 35 because the bar still adds them according to their order and not according to their *visible* order.

And this is the main reason we cannot really use the Rapid Board, being stuck with the old Classic Boards.

Using the Epic or Version filter for example, we get the planned issues for the version and want to divide them into smaller sprints. Doing that however not only adds issue of the selected Version/Epic, but also ones that are merely hidden by the filter.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like filters to cause the plan mode to change the order when moving the sprint bar

fields.description:
Using the Agile Board as a Scrum Project it will always show all the Epics of the whole project. The filter applied for Component or Version do not filter the Epics Issues. 

But on the Classic Board, the Epics are filtered correctly.

I need to filter the Backlog on the Board showing only Epics from a specific version or component.
fields.summary: Filter Epic based on target version/component

fields.description:
The workflow we use is:

1) create bug report in Bonfire
2) click link to new issue detail page provided by Bonfire
3) click "View on Board" link
4) click gear on issue card
5) click "Send to Top"
6) scroll to top of backlog
7) drag issue into current sprint

Steps 4-7 could be avoided by simply having links to that say "Add to Sprint XYZ" in addition to the "View on Board" link.
fields.summary: As scrum master, I want to add an issue to an active sprint from the issue detail page.

fields.description:
Users of our instance have requested the ability to generate charts like those already provided as the "Agile Gadget", except that they want to be able to specify a parameter that is normally calculated, and see how that impacts the chart.

The specific case they are asking for is to be able to specify a particular velocity, and then see how that impacts the time required to fully burn down a daily statistic to complete the work in the version. I don't know all the particulars of how the chart data is calculated, so I can't be more specific about how such a thing would be implemented.

This is one case, and there may be others that make sense to also provide for those working potential scenarios based on parameters that are not normally inputs.
fields.summary: Support "what if" configurations for agile gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8630].
  {panel}

When viewing an issue, there is a 'View on Board' link in the Agile Section. Command+click or Ctrl+click the 'View on Board' link, opens the issue again in a popup window (but everything appears messed) overlapping the current issue:

!view_on_board.png|thumbnail!

Problem reproduced using Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox.

P.S.: Command+click or Ctrl+click in another links displayed on the page opens the link on a new page without any problems.
fields.summary: The "View on Board" option does not open in a new tab

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open Plan Mode or Work Mode
# Choose an issue which is in an active sprint (and hence Estimate is not editable)
# Click on Summary to edit
# Type a new value
# Tab to submit the edit

Focus shifts to Description, the next editable field. However the issue detail view header (which contains Summary) has been shifted/scrolled, with no way to return it to normal (reloading detail view fixes it).

See video.
fields.summary: Tabbing out of editing issue summary causes detail view header to be displaced

fields.description:
I need to be able to track the original estimate as constant. 

Actual:
If a user edits directly in the 'Remaining:' field in the work view the value is copied to the Original Estimate field and overwrites the value. This is not the case if the user clicks the '+' and enters work on the Log Work Form.

Expected:
Editing remaining estimate would not effect original estimate
fields.summary: Editing Remaining Estimate in Work View changes Original Estimate to the same value

fields.description:

We should have an option to use the columns from the board or make this the default behavior in the gadget.
